catalogue_raissonne: Guiffrey 247 (Reclining Woman); Guiffrey 228 (Woman Selling Fried Food)
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: top image: nude female reclining on PL side; dark shadowy figure at L bottom image: woman sitting on chair near a store at L; two men seated across from her in slight shadow at L; bucket at her foot; wooden pillar behind woman
inscription: -- in graphite at bottom of sheet: a) femme couchee | b) La Marchande de friture (seller of fried fish) | McCarron TKK | a 60 ex. | G247 | G228
provenance: [Paul McCarron, New York; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Reclining Woman and Woman Selling Fried Food
